title.narrative: DIVERSION, PROBATION AND REHABILITATION

description.narrative: 2. The protective environment is strengthened in line with international standards for child victims, witnesses and offenders a. The draft and existing legislation on children in contact with the law are reviewed (relevant codes, laws and by-laws on probation, diversion, alternative sentencing, etc.) to identify gaps with international standards and practices and areas for strengtheningb. Key stakeholders agree on the feasibility, format and key directions of a medium term policy document or strategy that addresses child's rights and their protectionc. Consultations with key stakeholders and experts on strategic visioning for children in contact with the law result in identification of key priorities, components and directions of the policy document/ strategyd. Key stakeholders can access a medium-term policy document/ strategy on advancing Justice for Children, which contributes to Access To Justice, Evaluation And Research, Justice For Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 2: Children, especially those in difficult life circumstances, suffer, witness and practice less psychological and physical maltreatment, including all forms of harm, abuse, neglect, and exploitation at home, in school, in care, in custody and in public spaces.

description.narrative: The Parliament of Kazakhstan and government continued improving the implementation procedures in provision of support to children in difficult situations and conflict with the law. UNICEF proposed ;the operational modality of alternative service provision and referrals (Medical social registry) and contributed to the dialogue on new policy changes, ratification of the third Optional Protocol to the Convention on the Rights of the Child on a communications procedure, an important step to ensure access to justice for all children.; | Status:Met | As-of Date:18/01/2021
